channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @Foone And yet I’m watching Trek on a PADD. Related: At the beginning of Star Trek: Nemesis, Picard has a pile of iPads on his desk, apparently because the intranet is down and there is no way to get staff reports onto his pad.
@Lexaphus I think you should strongly consider turning your rabbinate into one of hosting monthly themed Shabbat dinners.

@Foone Ok, if you’re doing Trek, I need to share some retro technology I spotted rewatching The Cage. https://t.co/WGrvtuALlf
@Foone Yes, Pike’s Enterprise originally had a TTY printer on the bright, rather than a video display. https://t.co/C6UpFVhTMB
@KathStarkey_ @socio_steve @LucasOfSunshine He gets lavish public housing in Manhattan. Not a huge fan of the Far East Side, but for the rent reduction I’d move back across the Hudson.
@mikrmoore Here's the AIPAC counterargument. I'd love to see some engagement with it. https://t.co/kZbaZ3vhl0

@dylanotes @EladNehorai @mehdirhasan That’s quite a pivot!
@dylanotes @EladNehorai @mehdirhasan If I were running J Street at the moment, I’d launch a “How to talk your dad about AIPAC” campaign.
@punkonbus1701 @datadivajf Wait. When was that mentioned? (I’m only halfway through my rewatch and don’t want to miss it.)
@dylanotes @EladNehorai @mehdirhasan Did they ever hire the progressive outreach staffer they advertised for a while back?
@JeffWhampton @SheikhAlJamal @cr3 @paleofuture @journodave Seriously: Better now than a year from now, with twice as much “money” being lost.
@EladNehorai Remind me of how the battle against the devil’s rock and roll turned out?

@AD_Lobel Ah, the good old days when Starships had teletype machines on bridge, as God intended. https://t.co/QJfm989xh6
@AD_Lobel https://t.co/qxVyGkdO8b

@Popehat Is there any First Amendment precedent distinguishing between “viewpoint discrimination” and “hate speech” for moderators to fall back on? (Not that Republican judges feel bound by precedent.)
Tell me your party is an affinity scam without…. https://t.co/KhnOdRsyyW
@UnhitchingHour @Sheilby24 @Popehat @therealsplett2 Nor to the Alito Court.
@EmExAstris @JustSayXtian Well, if they’re based in Texas, it is illegal for twitter to penalize them for hate speech.
@KatzOnEarth Who we don’t think are bad enough to denounce as a party. So any swing district Republican can say, “No, I’m a bipartisan Republican.”
@DavidWolkenfeld @jh_swanson He alternates with experts whose premise he doesn’t challenge. So you can think you’re being interviewed for your expertise, not your expose.

The flip side: We need to be hammering away at how harmful fundamentalist religion is. We need to be reminding everyone of the Bible Belt’s dysfunctions, its divorces and murders. https://t.co/yKkceiHoKQ

This. But also: Everything you think you know about your rights no longer hold true. The Alito Court is explicitly not bound by precedent — nor even the need to justify its opinions with a formal decision. https://t.co/5UE3XwAZnO
Until the Court is expanded or reduced, all of our freedoms are subject to the whims of unrepresentative legislators and these unelected judges appointed by presidents elected by a minority of the population.

You may think that this is a horrible decision by @TwitterSupport. And you would be right. But according to a Republican law just approved by two Trump-appointed judges, it would be *illegal* to penalize the operator of the cited hateful account. https://t.co/YxZfkXHRH4
It might be legal to ban the use of the twitter handle, but it might not. @AkivaMCohen can correct me, but in a quick read of the Texas law, the question would hinge on whether one’s choice of twitter hand is counts as communication.
Remember: The Texas law is at odds with settle jurisprudence, but this court has repeatedly shown that 1) they’re not bound by traditional jurisprudence and 2) they don’t feel the need to show their work.

@HeerJeet Do you think she might have abandoned conservative polemics for a more wholesome pursuit had her husband, say, run off in 1965 with a time traveling Jackie O lookalike sent from our looming dystopic future to make things right?
@HeerJeet I’m imagining a Commentary that pivoted back to liberalism, offering just enough of a historical nudge to elect Ted Kennedy in 1980….
@rmneiss I’m sure she’ll be equally brave in championing the rights of American journalists after Alito reverts First Amendment jurisprudence.
@bernstein_judah Is the demand for simplistic equalities antisemitic? Or just a denial of the Talmud’s fundamental premise?

@trekonomics Given its geopolitical situation, I don’t think being a tax haven would have helped the regime’s longevity. Not at that stage.
@trekonomics Maybe if France had the foresight to adopt the Swiss approach in 1918….
The First Amendment is whatever Alito decides it is. All of our 20th century rights are now alienable — at least until the court is expanded or contracted. https://t.co/xDOoiGijFj
